title: Isolation
text: We can isolate the variable term by using the addition property.
speech: We can isolate the variable term by using the addition property.
pacedSpeech: We can isolate the variable term by using the addition property.

title: Addition
text: What should we add in order to isolate the variable with its coefficient on the right?
speech: What should we add in order to isolate the variable with its coefficient on the right?
pacedSpeech: What should we add in order to isolate the variable with its coefficient on the right?

title: Addition
text: What do we get after we add $$x-1$$ on both sides?
speech: What do we get after we add  x minus 1  on both sides?
pacedSpeech: What do we get after we add   x minus 1

title: Isolation
text: We can leave the variable term by itself on the right by using the multiplication property.
speech: We can leave the variable term by itself on the right by using the multiplication property.
pacedSpeech: We can leave the variable term by itself on the right by using the multiplication property.

title: Multiplication
text: What number should we multiply in order to isolate the variable by itself?
speech: What number should we multiply in order to isolate the variable by itself?
pacedSpeech: What number should we multiply in order to isolate the variable by itself?

title: Multiplication
text: What do we get after we multiply $$\frac{2}{3}$$ on both sides?
speech: What do we get after we multiply  2 thirds  on both sides?
pacedSpeech: What do we get after we multiply   2 thirds

title: Interval Notation
text: $$(b,\infty)$$ represents all real numbers greater than $$b$$, but not including $$b$$.
speech: the open interval from b to infinity  represents all real numbers greater than  b , but not including  b .
pacedSpeech: the open interval from b to infinity
represents all real numbers greater than   b
